column1:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column2:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately captures the information provided in the original statement.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately captures the information provided in the original statement.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B in terms of accuracy (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B in terms of accuracy (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other in terms of accuracy (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A in terms of accuracy (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A in terms of accuracy (Score 2)

Reasoning for Scoring
- Score -2: Summary A significantly better captures the information in the original statement compared to Summary B.
- Score -1: Summary A slightly better captures the information in the original statement compared to Summary B.
- Score 0: Neither summary is better than the other in terms of accurately capturing the information in the original statement.
- Score 1: Summary B slightly better captures the information in the original statement compared to Summary A.
- Score 2: Summary B significantly better captures the information in the original statement compared to Summary A.
